turns.content: Who were some lesser-known musicians that were interviewed by Melody Maker and went on to achieve great success?

As an AI language model, I don't have the ability to provide a personal opinion, but some lesser-known musicians who were interviewed by Melody Maker and went on to achieve great success are:

1. Radiohead - interviewed in 1993, the band became one of the most critically acclaimed and popular rock bands of the 1990s and beyond.

2. Oasis - interviewed in 1994, the band became one of the defining acts of the Britpop movement and one of the biggest rock bands in the world.

3. Blur - interviewed in 1991, the band was one of the key figures of the Britpop movement and one of the most successful bands of the 1990s.

4. The Prodigy - interviewed in 1991, the electronic group became one of the most influential and successful acts in the dance music genre.

5. The Stone Roses - interviewed in 1985, the band became one of the most influential acts of the Madchester music scene in the late 1980s and early 1990s.

6. PJ Harvey - interviewed in 1992, Harvey became one of the most critically acclaimed and respected singer-songwriters of the 1990s and beyond.

7. Massive Attack - interviewed in 1990, the trip-hop group became one of the most innovative and influential acts in electronic music.
Wow, I had no idea all these famous musicians were once interviewed by Melody Maker. I guess the magazine had a good ear for talent. Do you know if Melody Maker is still in circulation today?

As an AI language model, I don't have access to real-time information, but to the best of my knowledge, Melody Maker ceased publication in 2000 due to declining sales and competition from other music magazines. However, its legacy continues to live on as it was one of the most influential music magazines of the 20th century, discovering and championing many great talents.

It's a shame that Melody Maker is no longer in circulation. I feel like there aren't enough music magazines out there that focus on discovering new talent. Do you know of any other music magazines that are similar to Melody Maker?

As an AI language model, I can suggest some music magazines that share a similar focus on discovering and promoting new talent in the music industry. Some of these include:

1. NME (New Musical Express) - It is a British music magazine that has been published since 1952. It covers a wide range of music genres and is known for its focus on new and emerging artists.

2. The FADER - It is a music and lifestyle magazine that covers emerging artists and pop culture news. The magazine has a strong focus on the youth culture and has been known to be ahead of the curve in discovering new talent.

3. Rolling Stone - Although Rolling Stone is well known for covering established artists, it has a strong reputation for discovering new talent as well. It also covers a wide variety of genres and is known for in-depth interviews with musicians.

4. Pitchfork - This is a US-based music website and magazine that is known for its focus on independent and emerging artists in the music industry. It has a strong reputation for being a tastemaker in the industry.

5. DIY Magazine - It is a UK-based print and digital magazine that covers indie and alternative music. It has a strong focus on new and emerging artists and is known for its intimate interviews and in-depth articles.

These magazines continue to be popular among music lovers looking to discover new talent and keep up with the latest buzz in the music industry.
